result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Johannes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick D Johannes

Probation review hearing on April 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
9:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to the charge, enhancer will be dismissed and will recommend probation.  Defendant concurs.  Corut goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guiltyon count 1 and strikes the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail with huber, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:40 a.m.
Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:43 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant has met with the DA, but does not accept the offer and requests to get an attorney.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:44 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on April 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 4, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:01 a.m.
